text: The 2003 FIBA Africa Championship was the 22nd FIBA Africa Championship, played under the rules of FIBA, the world governing body for basketball, and the FIBA Africa thereof. The tournament was hosted by Egypt from August 7 to 16 2003. Angola defeated Nigeria 85–65 in the final to win their seventh title. and securing a spot at the 2004 Summer Olympics. ==Squads== ==Draw== {| class="wikitable" width=40% !width=25%|Group A !width=25%|Group B |- | | |} == Preliminary round == :Times given below are in UTC+2. === Group A === {| class="infobox bordered" |- |width=10px bgcolor="#ccffcc"| ||Qualified for the semi-finals |} {|class=wikitable |- align=center !width=150px| Team !!width=30px| Pts. !!width=20px| W !!width=20px| L !!width=40px| PF !!width=40px| PA !!width=40px| Diff |- align=center bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| |9||4||1||366||299|| +67 |- align=center bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| |9||4||1||431||357|| +74 |- align=center |align=left| |8||3||2||399||340|| +59 |- align=center |align=left| |7||2||3||376||382|| -6 |- align=center |align=left| |6||1||4||261||402|| -141 |- align=center |align=left| |6||1||4||360||413|| -53 |} \---- \---- \---- \---- === Group B === {| class="infobox bordered" |- |width=10px bgcolor="#ccffcc"| ||Qualified for the semi-finals |} {|class=wikitable |- align=center !width=150px| Team !!width=30px| Pts. !!width=20px| W !!width=20px| L !!width=40px| PF !!width=40px| PA !!width=40px| Diff |- align=center bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| |10||5||0||454||307|| +147 |- align=center bgcolor="#ccffcc" |align=left| |8||3||2||410||363|| +47 |- align=center |align=left| |8||3||2||369||314|| +55 |- align=center |align=left| |7||2||3||350||394|| -44 |- align=center |align=left| |7||2||3||258||310|| -52 |- align=center |align=left| |5||0||5||249||402|| -153 |} \---- \---- \---- \---- ==Knockout stage== ===11th place match=== ===9th place match=== ===7th place match=== ===5th place match=== ===Semifinals bracket=== ===Bronze medal match=== ===Final=== ==Final standings== {| class="infobox bordered" |- |width=10px bgcolor="#ccffcc"| ||Qualified for the 2004 Summer Olympics |} {| class="wikitable" |- !
